title: Algorithm that would most benefit from a heuristic

content.question: For which of the following situations would it be best to use a heuristic in order to find a solution that runs in a reasonable amount of time?

choices.label: Appending a value to a list of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> elements, which requires no list elements be examined.

Finding the fastest route that visits every location among <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> locations, which requires <math alttext="n!" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> possible routes be examined.

Performing a binary search for a score in a sorted list of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> scores, which requires that fewer than <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> scores be examined.

Performing a linear search for a name in an unsorted database of <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> people, which requires that up to <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> entries be examined.

content.answer: Finding the fastest route that visits every location among <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> locations, which requires <math alttext="n!" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>!</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> possible routes be examined.
